alert.note: Alert for Lyon; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 6:55PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Shawnee, Wabaunsee, western Osage and northern Lyon Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Belvue to near Americus. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rossville, Eskridge, Dover, Silver Lake, Burlingame, Americus, Maple Hill, McFarland, Harveyville, Reading, Paxico, Allen, Admire, Willard, Bushong and Keene. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 330 and 353. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 135 and 166. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.
